ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Umbra/RabbitMQ Problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Markus, Not sure what s going on. I looked at the code where your exception is coming from, and googled your stack trace, but didn t find anything

Hello Markus,

Not sure what's going on. I looked at the code where your ex=
ception is
coming from, and googled your stack trace, but didn't find anyth=
ing
particularly helpful. If you want to send your full crawler-beans.cxml =
I
can take a look. There's nothing unusual in your rabbitmq configuration i=
s
there?

Noah

m 07.07.2015 um 07:24 schrieb Noah Levitt nlevitt@...
> [archive-cr=
awler]:
>
>
>  Hello Markus,
>
>  There is something that
> https://sbforge=
.org/display/NAS/Integrating+Umbra+And+Heritrix+3 neglects
> to mention tha=
t might explain the problem you're seeing. AMPQUrlReceiver
> needs to be co=
nfigured with a "queueName" that matches the clientId set on
> AMQPPublishP=
rocessor.
>
>  Here is an example of the relevant configuration from an arc=
hive-it
> crawl job. Our shouldProcessRule sends only seeds to umbra. There=
 are
> reasons for the particular way it works which I can explain if anyon=
e is
> wondering. :) But the important thing to be aware of is that the
> s=
houldProcessRule can be used to limit the umbra treatment to the urls of
> =
your choice.
>
>           <bean id=3D"amqpUrlReceiver"
> class=3D"org.arch=
ive.crawler.frontier.AMQPUrlReceiver">
>                 <property name=3D"=
queueName"
> value=3D"archiveit.prod.9876-20150704232858960"/>
>           =
      <property name=3D"amqpUri"
> value=3D"amqp://guest:guest@localhost:56=
72/%2f"/>
>         </bean>
>
>          <bean id=3D"amqpPublishProcessor"
=
> class=3D"org.archive.modules.AMQPPublishProcessor">
>                 <pr=
operty name=3D"amqpUri"
> value=3D"amqp://guest:guest@localhost:5672/%2f"/>=

>                 <property name=3D"clientId"
> value=3D"archiveit.prod.98=
76-20150704232858960"/>
>                 <property name=3D"shouldProcessRu=
le">
>                         <bean
> class=3D"org.archive.modules.decider=
ules.ExpressionDecideRule">
>                                 <property nam=
e=3D"decision" value=3D"REJECT"/>
>                                 <proper=
ty name=3D"groovyExpression"
> value=3D"!(curi.via =3D=3D null && (=
curi.hasBeenLinkExtracted() ||
> (curi.getFetchStatus() >=3D 300 &&a=
mp; curi.getFetchStatus() <
> 400)))"/>
>                         </bean=
>
>                 </property>
>         </bean>
>
>  If the problem persi=
sts, please send the full stack trace.
>
>  Noah
>
>
> On Mon, Jul 6, 2015 =
at 3:27 AM, 'Markus.Mirsberger'
> markus.mirsberger@... [archive-crawler=
] <
> archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
>>
>>
>> Hi,
>>
>> I am try=
ing to crawl websites through Umbra / RabbitMQ to get more URLs
>> generate=
d by JS.
>> I set up everything as it is described here:
>> https://sbforge=
.org/display/NAS/Integrating+Umbra+And+Heritrix+3
>>
>> I can see in my cra=
wl logs that the URLs are beeing sent to
>> Umbra/RabbitMQ because of the S=
tatus *sentToAMQP*
>> I think this means that so far my Requests are succes=
sfully sent .....I
>> can see the requests in the RabbitMQ Webadmin as well=
.
>>
>> The problem is that I can not see anything comming back from
>> Umb=
ra/RabbitMQ ..... the documentation says that I should see URLs with the
>>=
 status* received* *FromAMQP*. This doesnt happen but instead I get this
>>=
 in my job logs:
>>
>> *SEVERE problem starting AMQP consumer (will try aga=
in after 30 seconds)
>> (in thread 'AMQPUrlReceiver-starter-restarter')*
>>=

>> My logfile from rabbitmq says this:
>>
>> =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-=
Jul-2015::12:24:41 =3D=3D=3D
>> accepting AMQP connection <0.15717.1733> (1=
27.0.0.1:45721 ->
>> 127.0.0.1:5672)
>>
>> =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul=
-2015::12:24:45 =3D=3D=3D
>> accepting AMQP connection <0.15762.1733> (127.=
0.0.1:45724 ->
>> 127.0.0.1:5672)
>>
>> =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul-20=
15::12:25:21 =3D=3D=3D
>> closing AMQP connection <0.15762.1733> (127.0.0.1=
:45724 -> 127.0.0.1:5672
>> )
>>
>> =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul-2015::=
12:25:21 =3D=3D=3D
>> closing AMQP connection <0.15717.1733> (127.0.0.1:457=
21 -> 127.0.0.1:5672
>> )
>>
>>
>> As you can see rabbitmq is acception 2 c=
onnections from heritrix and when
>> I finish the crawl both are closed.
>>=
 I think they are used to send the URLs. After acception the connections
>>=
 and some seconds the "AMQP consumer" problem occours and keeps comming
>> =
every 30 seconds as the AMQPUrlReceiver tries to start a consumer.
>>
>> Do=
es anyone have an idea what might be the problem? Did I miss anything
>> wh=
ich wasn't described in the howto above?
>>
>>
>> Thanks,
>> Markus
>>
>>
>=
>
>>
>>
>
>
>
>
